description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} whose shortest block is of length k (1 <= k <= n). A block of a permutation is a maximal sequence of consecutive integers which appear in consecutive positions. For example, the permutation 4512367 has 3 blocks: 45, 123, and 67. Its shortest block has length 2.
